intro: Jacquiniella leucomelana, commonly known as the white-veined daisy, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other similar plants. The plant is characterized by its white-veined leaves and small, daisy-like flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Jacquiniella leucomelana is often used in traditional medicine and as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance.
